description._content: Play Video A new promotional piece by videographer Matt Wolf closely tied to our mission, featuring both Museum visitors and the collection. At the December 1 Target First Saturday, staff photographer, Christine Gant, took portraits of visitors. Wolf combined these portraits with images of collection objects and installation views taken by ten members of the Brooklyn Museum's Flickr community. Matt Wolf just completed his first feature film, Wild Combination, a documentary portrait of the avant-garde cellist and disco producer Arthur Russell. The film premiers in early 2008. Wolf moved to New York when he received a full tuition fellowship to attend film school at NYU. His short films have screened in numerous film festivals, art galleries, and universities worldwide. These films and other gallery installations have been featured and reviewed in The New York Times, Village Voice, and other publications. Currently Wolf is directing documentaries for The New York Times and New York's innovative public art organization Creative Time. Contributing Flickr Photographers Ranjit Bhatnagar Amy Dreher James M. Hanlon Sam Horine Gulshan Kirat Gretchen Ludwig Frank Lynch Trish Mayo Stephen Sandoval Matt Verzola The video features the track "Mustt Mustt" by Brooklyn Qawwali Party.  Check out this group which highlights a small sampling of the photographs that were taken for this video. We hope that you will enjoy looking through these and learning more about the photographers who contributed to this project. www.brooklynmuseum.org/community/videos/project_spring_2008/
